oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Encased hand-tinted tintype of Union soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Brothers Cpl. Jesse Mercer Pirkle (l), and 1st Sgt. Elijah Jefferson Pirkle (r), both of Co. Georgia, 3rd Tenn. Cav., USA. Elijah Pirkle initially joined as a private in Co. B, 36th Inf., CSA. He deserted and later joined the U.S. army with his brother in July 1863. They walked from Cleveland, Tennessee to Nashville to muster in. In Sept. 1864, Elijah was shot near Florence, Alabama and spent the rest of the war in the hospital. Jesse was captured at Sulphur Trestle, Alabama, imprisoned at Andersonville, and survived.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pirkle, Jesse Mercer;Pirkle, Elijah J.
